sen.j: 葵の上（あおいのうえ）は紫式部の物語『源氏物語』に登場する架空の人物。
sen.e: Lady Aoi is a fictional character appearing in "The Tale of Genji" by Lady Murasaki.

sen.j: 光源氏の最初の正妻。
sen.e: Hikaru Genji's first lawful wife.
She is Hikaru Genji's first lawful wife.

sen.j: 源氏との間に一粒種（夕霧 (源氏物語)）をもうける。
sen.e: She has a single son with Genji (Yugiri).
sen.cmt: 原文中の「 (源氏物語)」の部分についてはウェブ上で参照するためでしたので、訳出では省略しました。（以下同じ）

sen.j: この名は後世の読者がつけた便宜上の名前で、彼女が主役級の扱いを受ける「葵 (源氏物語)」帖から取られている。
sen.e: This name, given by readers in later generations for convenience, comes from the chapter 'Aoi' (Hollyhock) where she is treated as a person of leading character rank.

sen.j: 父は桐壺帝時代の左大臣、母は桐壺帝の妹の大宮 (源氏物語)。
sen.e: Her father was the Sadaijin (Minister of the Left) in the reign of Emperor Kiritsubo and her mother was Omiya, the younger sister of Emperor Kiritsubo.

sen.j: 頭中将という同腹のきょうだいがいる（どちらが年上なのかは作中では不明）。
sen.e: She has a brother called To no Chujo (which of the two is elder is unclear in the story.).

sen.j: 光源氏の従姉にあたる。
sen.e: She is a cousin of Hikaru Genji.
She is a cousin of Hikaru Genji.
She is a cousin of Hikaru Genji.

sen.j: 当初東宮（のちの朱雀帝）妃にと希望されていたが、左大臣の思惑で元服した源氏の北の方に納まる（「桐壺」）。
sen.e: She was at first intended as the wife of the Crown Prince (Later Emperor Suzaku), but according to the Sadaijin's plans, she became the lawful wife of Genji after he completed his initiation ceremonies into adulthood ('Kiritsubo' (The Paulownia Court)).

She was, at first, intended to be the wife of the Crown Prince (Later Emperor Suzaku), but in accordance with the Sadaijin's plans, she became the lawful wife of Genji after he completed his initiation ceremonies into adulthood ('Kiritsubo' (The Paulownia Court)).

sen.j: だが密かに藤壺を恋い慕う源氏には、后がね（皇后候補）として大切に育てられた深窓の姫とはいえ物足りない心地がした。
sen.e: However, Genji, who had been secretly in love with Fujitsubo, felt unsatisfied with Aoi despite the fact that she had been brought up with the greatest care in a good family as a candidate for empress.

sen.j: 葵の上も他の女君にうつつを抜かす4歳下の夫にうちとけずよそよそしい態度をとっていた。
sen.e: Lady Aoi also did not lower her guard to her husband, who was four years her junior and was often smitten with other ladies, and took a distant attitude to him.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Lady Aoi also did not lower her guard to her husband, who was four years her junior and often smitten with other ladies, and maintained a very distant attitude toward him.

sen.j: 源氏との夫婦仲の冷淡さは、葵の上が詠んだ和歌が一首も登場しないことにも象徴されている（「帚木 (源氏物語)」～「花宴」）。
sen.e: The cold relations between her and Genji are symbolized by the fact that no waka poems composed by Lady Aoi appear in the story (from 'Hahakigi' (The Broom Tree) through 'Hana no En' (The Festival of the Cherry Blossoms)).

sen.j: 10年後（源氏22歳）にようやく懐妊、周囲は喜びに沸いた。
sen.e: Ten years later (when Genji was twenty-two years old), she finally became pregnant, and the people around them grew excited with delight.

sen.j: 源氏もつわりの苦しさに心細そうな葵の上の様子に珍しく愛しさを感じた。
sen.e: Genji found that Lady Aoi looked anxious due to painful morning sickness, and felt a love for her as he rarely had before.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Genji found that Lady Aoi looked helpless due to painful morning sickness, and felt a love for her as he rarely had before.

sen.j: 折りしも時は賀茂祭（葵祭、4月 (旧暦)）、周囲に勧められるままに斎院の御禊の見物に行った。
sen.e: Just then, it was the season of the Kamo festival (the Aoi (Hollyhock) Festival, in the fourth month (old calendar)), and on the advice of the people around her she went to watch the purification ceremony performed by the Saiin (Imperial Princess appointed to serve the deities of the Kamo-jinja Shrines).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: ところが、図らずも家来が源氏の愛人の六条御息所の家来と車争いし、御息所の牛車を壊し恥をかかせてしまう。
sen.e: However, her retainers unexpectedly got into a fight with the retainers of Rokujo no Miyasudokoro, Genji's lover, broke Rokujo no Miyasudokoro's gissha (ox-drawn carriage) and disgraced her.

sen.j: この頃から葵の上は物の怪に悩まされて臥せるようになった。
sen.e: Since around this period, Lady Aoi was afflicted by a vengeful spirit and became sick in bed.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: From this point on, Lady Aoi was afflicted by a vengeful spirit and became sick and bedridden.

sen.j: 床を見舞った源氏の前で彼女に取りついた御息所の生霊が姿を見せるという事件が起きた。
sen.e: Before the eyes of Genji visiting Aoi in bed, it happened that the spirit of Rokujo no Miyasudokoro appeared, who had been possessing her.

sen.e: When Genji was paying a visit to Aoi in bed, the spirit of Rokujo no Miyasudokoro, who had been possessing her, appeared before his very eyes.

sen.j: 8月 (旧暦)の中ごろに難産の末夕霧を産んだ。
sen.e: It was around the middle of the eighth month (old calendar) that she gave birth to Yugiri after a difficult delivery.

sen.j: そして源氏との仲も修復されたと思うもつかの間、秋の司召の夜に急に苦しんで呆気なく他界。
sen.e: After a brief period where she and Genji patched up their relationship, she suddenly started to suffer and died all too soon on the night of the autumn conference on promotions and appointments.

sen.j: 火葬と葬儀は8月20日 (旧暦)過ぎに行われた。
sen.e: Her cremation and funeral was conducted in the late Eighth Month (old lunar calendar).

sen.e: Her cremation and funeral was conducted in the latter part of the Eighth Month (old lunar calendar).

sen.j: 源氏はそれまで妻に冷たくあたってきたことを後悔しつつ、左大臣邸にこもって喪に服した（「葵 (源氏物語)」）。
sen.e: Deeply regretting his having been cold to her, Genji confined himself to the Sadaijin's residence and went into mourning ('Aoi' (Hollyhock)).
